item.title: COVID-19 update
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: To our patients and community members, The unprecedented outbreak of COVID-19 has had a tremendous impact on our country and lives. As of late, our office hours have been very limited, with the main focus being on seeing major dental emergencies. Rest assured, we are carefully following all of the guidelines put forth by the...
item.content:encoded:
To our patients and community members, The unprecedented outbreak of COVID-19 has had a tremendous impact on our country and lives. As of late, our office hours have been very limited, with the main focus being on seeing major dental emergencies. Rest assured, we are carefully following all of the guidelines put forth by the CDC when seeing patients. It is our hope that this period of uncertainty...

item.title: Why My Patients are Throwing Their Toothbrushes Away
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Happy November! I am SO excited that the holidays are upon us! It’s one of my favorite times of the year! But unfortunately, if you are like many people this time of year is loaded with ALL the nasty germs that can ruin your holiday fun. What you probably may NOT realize, is that your...
item.content:encoded:
Happy November! I am SO excited that the holidays are upon us! It’s one of my favorite times of the year! But unfortunately, if you are like many people this time of year is loaded with ALL the nasty germs that can ruin your holiday fun. What you probably may NOT realize, is that your oral hygiene often plays a factor in how often (and how long) you stay sick. So to help you get through this...

item.title: 4 Kids Drinks That Have More Sugar Than Their Halloween Candy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Happy October! If you are anything like me, you are counting down the days to Halloween. It may come as a shock since I’m a dentist, but what can I say? I LOVE candy. (My favorites come in the form of chocolate bars!) Normally, I make it a point this time of year to stress...
item.content:encoded:
Happy October! If you are anything like me, you are counting down the days to Halloween. It may come as a shock since I’m a dentist, but what can I say? I LOVE candy. (My favorites come in the form of chocolate bars!) Normally, I make it a point this time of year to stress the importance maintaining good dental hygiene to prevent damage to teeth (or dental gear) while enjoying extra treats.

item.title: 3 Ways to Make Sure Your Breath is Date Night Fresh
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Happy September! Have you ever been in this situation? You are attending a wedding or important dinner and meet someone new, but you’re afraid to speak because you’re afraid your breath may stink. Even if you are diligent about flossing, brushing and using mouthwash, you wonder if it’s enough.   Almost 25% of people suffer...
item.content:encoded:
Happy September! Dentist Pediatric Chamblee GA Have you ever been in this situation? You are attending a wedding or important dinner and meet someone new, but you’re afraid to speak because you’re afraid your breath may stink. Even if you are diligent about flossing, brushing and using mouthwash, you wonder if it’s enough. Almost 25% of people suffer from the embarrassing condition of bad breath.

item.content:encoded:

All the neighbors grimaced and held their breath until everything was checked out, and an “all clear” signal was given. It’s like a youth’s rite of passage. Kids between the ages of seven and 10, especially those who play baseball or basketball, have the highest number of...

item.title: 5 Steps to Make Your Kid Comfortable in the Dentist’s Chair
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: As an adult, you already know that dental health is important. As a parent, you may be wondering at what point you need to start worrying about your child’s dental health. The short answer is, right now. Children can start developing cavities as soon as they have teeth. In fact, 42% of children have experienced...
item.content:encoded:
As an adult, you already know that dental health is important. As a parent, you may be wondering at what point you need to start worrying about your child’s dental health. The short answer is, right now. Children can start developing cavities as soon as they have teeth. In fact, 42% of children have experienced tooth decay by age 11. And most of this is preventable by following good dental hygiene...

Source

item.title: Invisalign for Adults

item.description: We believe you’re never too old to straighten your teeth. Many of our patients are adults who are currently undergoing treatment. item.content:encoded:
We believe you’re never too old to straighten your teeth. Many of our patients are adults who are currently undergoing treatment. Did you know that roughly 30 percent of all orthodontic patients these days are adults? Whether you had braces as a teen but your teeth have shifted, or you have never undergone orthodontics but always wanted to, we can help you enjoy straighter teeth, an improved bite...

item.title: Valuable Suggestions When You Need a Dentist
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: When you hire a dentist, they are responsible for a lot more than simply filling cavities and such. Given the fact that everything in your body is in some way or another connected; having troubles in your mouth can easily affect other parts too. This is why it is crucial that your dentist be trustworthy...
item.content:encoded:
When you hire a dentist, they are responsible for a lot more than simply filling cavities and such. Given the fact that everything in your body is in some way or another connected; having troubles in your mouth can easily affect other parts too. This is why it is crucial that your dentist be trustworthy and for you to be assured of his competency. In this article, you will find some great advice...

item.title: Important Points to Keep in Mind When Hiring a New Dentist
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Keeping your teeth healthy will be easier when you have the right dentist. You can’t find any substitute for dental care that is high quality, but you can do plenty on your own, like flossing and brushing. Cavities happen no matter how careful you are, so dental procedures, such as root canals or fillings, are...
item.content:encoded:
Keeping your teeth healthy will be easier when you have the right dentist. You can’t find any substitute for dental care that is high quality, but you can do plenty on your own, like flossing and brushing. Cavities happen no matter how careful you are, so dental procedures, such as root canals or fillings, are inevitable. In this article, we’ll be looking at ways to find the best dentist for your...
